We can make this happen with something like:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>{{ if .IsHome -}} &lt;title&gt;{{ .Site.Title }}&lt;/title&gt; {{- else -}} &lt;title&gt;{{ .Title }} – {{ .Site.Title }}&lt;/title&gt; {{- end }} </code></pre><p>The difference here is that <code>{{ .Site.Title }}</code> is only used if the current page is the homepage.</p> <p>For every other page, we use the page title specified in the page front matter, which should almost always be unique and therefore good for SEO.</p> <p>For an alternative solution try:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">title</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> {{ if .Page.Title }}{{ .Page.Title }} - {{ end }}{{ .Site.Title }} </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">title</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This should be fairly self explanatory and produces the same results, in an arguably cleaner single line of code.</p> <h2 id="taking-it-further">Taking it further</h2> <p>For an added SEO boost, try applying the same thinking to your page descriptions. According to Google, “A page&rsquo;s description meta tag gives Google and other search engines a summary of what the page is about. Description meta tags are important because Google might use them as snippets for your pages”.</p> <p>The simple solution would be to define the description in the front matter of each page:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nn">---</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">title</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&#34;Hugo SEO: Unique, Accurate page titles&#34;</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">description</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&#34;Get an SEO boost on your website pages with descriptive page titles which make search engines happy&#34;</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nt">author</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&#34;Harry Cresswell&#34;</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"></span><span class="nn">---</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span></code></pre></div><p>Then call the <code>Parmeter</code> in a meta tag in your <code>&lt;head&gt;</code>:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>&lt;meta name=&#34;description&#34; content=&#34;{{ $.Param &#34;description&#34; }}&#34;&gt; </code></pre><p>Using some simple logic we can take this further still, <a href="https://github.com/harrycresswell/harry/blob/main/themes/hc-starter/layouts/partials/head.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">head over to github</a> if you’re interested in finding out how this works.</p> <p>There you have it. A couple of simple fixes to optimise your web pages and improve your chances of ranking higher in search engines.</p> <p>I hope this has been a helpful read.</p> <h2 id="further-reading">Further reading</h2> <ul> <li><a href="https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/7451184?hl=en#uniquepagetitles" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Create unique, accurate page titles</a> from Google’s SEO Starter Guide</li> </ul>

item.title: Objects
item.content:encoded: <p>This is Part 3 of my notes on Gordon Zhu’s <a href="https://watchandcode.com/p/practical-javascript" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Practical JavaScript</a>. This part focuses on turning the standalone functions created in <a href="notes/gordon-zhus-practical-javascript-functions/">part 2</a> to methods on an Object.</p> <p>Objects are great for organisation and will allow you to group your functions together, so everything related to your todo list is in one place and easy to access.</p> <h2 id="building-a-todo-app-v30----whats-an-object">Building a todo app v3.0 - What’s an Object?</h2> <p>You use Objects in Javascript to group related data and Functions together. Think about some real objects. Take your computer, for example.</p> <p>Your computer is a thing, or an ‘object’. And it has a certain set of unique properties:</p> <ul> <li>operatingSystem mac</li> <li>screenSize 15 inches</li> <li>purchaseYear 2015</li> </ul> <p>This is data that is related to a specific object: <strong>myComputer</strong>. Objects in Javascript are pretty much the same.</p> <h2 id="writing-an-object">Writing an Object</h2> <p>In Javascript, Curly braces can be used to group data in an Object:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">operatingSystem</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;mac&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">screenSize</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;15 inches&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">purchaseYear</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="mi">2015</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Each of these 3 things is called a <code>property</code>. Each property needs to be separated by a comma. The format of the property needs to contain a name and a value:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">propertyName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="nx">PropertyValue</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>In other words:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>operatingSystem: mac, </code></pre><p>Any text value will need to be surrounded by quotes. A number doesn’t need quotes.</p> <h2 id="using-an-object">Using an Object</h2> <p>To use an Object you will need to assign it to a Variable.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">myComputer</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">operatingSystem</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="nx">mac</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">screenSize</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;15 inches&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">purchaseYear</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="mi">2015</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Then you can type the variable in the console to retrieve the entire Object:</p> <p><code>myComputer</code></p> <p>To print out a specific part of the Object. You can do that by aappending a period, then the property name to the variable like this:</p> <p><code>myComputer.operatingSystem</code></p> <h2 id="objects-and-functions">Objects and Functions</h2> <p>Functions can be placed on Objects.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">harry</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">name</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Harry&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">sayName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">this</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>It’s optional to name functions on Objects. Most programmers leave out the name. Instead we can access the function by the property name.</p> <p>In other words,</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">sayName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">sayName</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>becomes:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">sayName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(){}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You can use <code>this</code> to reference the Object you are on.</p> <p>So, when you use <code>this</code> inside of a Function on an Object, <code>this</code> refers to the entire Object.</p> <p>In this case, when we run our <code>sayName</code> Function: <code>harry.sayName</code> will print out the entire Object.</p> <p>To print out a property on the Object, for example the name only, you can add <code>.name</code> to <code>this</code></p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">harry</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">name</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Harry&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">sayName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">name</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This pattern of putting a function on an Object is a common pattern in Javascript, and is referred to as ‘a Method’. A Method is simply a property which is equal to a Function.</p> <p>In this case, <code>sayName</code> is a Method, on the <code>harry</code> Object.</p> <p><strong>Remember, when you have a Function on an Object, you don’t need to give it a name as you can call it using the Property name. This is called an ‘Anonymous Function’.</strong></p> <h2 id="requirements">Requirements</h2> <p>The requirements for this version is to put everything we’ve done so far onto an Object.</p> <ul> <li>It should store the todos array on an Object</li> <li>It should have a displayTodos method</li> <li>It should have an addTodo method</li> <li>It should have a changeTodo method</li> <li>It should have a deleteTodo method</li> </ul> <p>This will help us organise our code better. So everything related to our todo list will be on a todoList Object.</p> <h2 id="step-1-store-todos-array-on-an-object">Step 1: Store Todos array on an Object</h2> <p>In the previous version of our app we stored our todos array in a variable:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todos</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">];</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>For this version we need to take our Array and put the data onto an Object.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todoList</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>To access the data inside our program we need to give it a variable name, in this case <code>todoList</code>.</p> <p>We can now type <code>todoList</code> in the console to retrieve the data.</p> <h2 id="step-2-create-displaytodos-method">Step 2: Create displayTodos method</h2> <p>Next we need to change displayTodos from the standard function we made in <a href="notes/parctical-javascript-functions">version 2</a>:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">(){</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;My Todos:&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>…to a method on our new todos object:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todoList</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;My Todos&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>To print out our todos on the console we type <code>todosList</code> followed by the <code>displayTodos</code> method, preppended with a dot:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">todoList</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You should now see your todos.</p> <h3 id="things-to-note">Things to note</h3> <p>One difference from <a href="notes/parctical-javascript-functions">version 2</a> is that we’re now using an anonymous function, as functions don’t need to be named when they’re a method. This is because when we run the function we use the property name instead, in this case <code>displayTodos</code>.</p> <p>Another difference is we’re now using <code>this.todos</code> instead of <code>todos</code>, as we no longer have the <code>todos</code> variable. The <code>this.</code> keyword allows us to refer to the <code>todos</code> property on the object we’re on.</p> <h2 id="step-3-create-an-addtodo-method">Step 3: Create an addTodo method</h2> <p>Now we need to change the addTodo function:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>…to an Method on our todoList Object:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todoList</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;My Todos&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Now <code>todos</code> and <code>displayTodos</code> are on this Object, we need to prepend with the <code>this.</code> keyword to reference those two properties. Otherwise it works exactly the same, just using an anonymous function, like in the previous step.</p> <p>Now you can use the addTodo method and add todos by typing:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">todoList</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;New Todo&#39;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Where ‘New Todo’ is the new value you would like to add.</p> <h2 id="step-4-create-a-changetodo-method">Step 4: Create a changeTodo method</h2> <p>Next we need to turn our changeTodo function:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>…into a method on our object:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todoList</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;My Todos&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You should now start to see the pattern; when you want to reference something on an object, use <code>this.</code>, to refer to the object itself.</p> <p>In this case we prefixed <code>todos</code> and <code>displayTodos</code> with <code>this.</code> because they are both already on the object.</p> <p>Now change a todo by running the change todo method:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">todoList</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;first&#39;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Where ‘0’ is the position of the todo (remember javaScript starts counting from zero), and ‘first’ is the new value of the todo at position zero.</p> <h2 id="step-5-create-a-deletetodo-method">Step 5: Create a deleteTodo method</h2> <p>Finally, we need to make our deleteTodo function:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">splice</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>…into a method on our object:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todoList</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item 1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item 3&#39;</span><span class="p">],</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">&#39;My Todos&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kd">function</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">postion</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">splice</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="k">this</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">}</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Similar to before, to delete an item in the todo list, use the todoList object and prepend the deleteTodo method, specifying to position of the item you wish to delete:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">todoList</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>In this case we delete the second item.</p> <p>By now you should see the pattern. The only real difference in a method on an object from a standalone function is that we need to add <code>this.</code>, so we can reference the appropriate data on the object. This is true for all our methods in our <code>todoList</code> object.</p> <h2 id="v30-review">v.3.0 Review</h2> <p>Now all our code is on an object, this is good for code organisation, as all code related to our <code>todoList</code> is grouped together.</p> <p>We practiced writing methods, which are simply functions on objects.</p> <p>Remember if you want to refer to the object itself, inside a method you need to use the <code>this</code> keyword, <code>this</code> refers to the entire method. Using the dot notation (the period; <code>this.</code>) allows us to reference different properties on this object.</p> <h2 id="next-steps">Next steps</h2> <p>Head over to <a href="https://watchandcode.com/p/practical-javascript" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Watchandcode.com</a> to take the course that these notes are based on.</p> <p>I highly recommend Gordon’s teaching style to anyone who has struggled to grasp common JS principles in the past. Gordon uses some of the best examples I’ve seen to explain JavaScript.</p>

item.title: Functions
item.content:encoded: <p>This is Part 2 of my notes on Gordon Zhu’s <a href="https://watchandcode.com/p/practical-javascript" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Practical JavaScript</a>, in this part we focus on improving our Todo App by using Functions to make our commands easier to write. Here’s <a href="notes/practical-javascript-arrays/">Part 1</a> incase you missed it.</p> <h2 id="building-a-todo-app-v20">Building a todo app v2.0</h2> <figure> <blockquote class="PullQuote PullQuote--right"> <p> “Functions are recipes” </p> <figcaption>&mdash; Gordon Zhu</figcaption> </blockquote> </figure> <p>Functions are like recipes; a set of instructions which can be given to someone so they know exactly what to do or how to make something.</p> <p>The point of a Function is to save you time, by distilling a long list of instructions into a single command:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>makeTurkeySandwich Get one slice of bread Add turkey Put slice of bread on top </code></pre><p>In Javascript that would look something like:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">makeTurkeySandwich</span><span class="p">(){</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Get</span> <span class="nx">one</span> <span class="nx">slice</span> <span class="k">of</span> <span class="nx">bread</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Add</span> <span class="nx">turkey</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Put</span> <span class="nx">slice</span> <span class="k">of</span> <span class="nx">bread</span> <span class="nx">on</span> <span class="nx">top</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>To run every step within a function use:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">makeTurkeySandwich</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><h2 id="customising-functions">Customising functions</h2> <p>Instead of writing several functions for each recipe (e.g turkey, ham, beef) we can use one function and customise the filling by using a variable.</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>makeSandwichWith ________ Get one slice of bread; Add _______; Put slice of bread on top; }; </code></pre><p>In JS:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">makeTurkeySandwich</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">filling</span><span class="p">){</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Get</span> <span class="nx">one</span> <span class="nx">slice</span> <span class="k">of</span> <span class="nx">bread</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Add</span> <span class="nx">filling</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">Put</span> <span class="nx">slice</span> <span class="k">of</span> <span class="nx">bread</span> <span class="nx">on</span> <span class="nx">top</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>The <code>filling</code> variable is whats know as a <strong>Parameter</strong>.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">makeSandwichWith</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;ham&#34;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>When using the function the variable is what’s known as an <strong>Argument</strong>.</p> <h2 id="requirements">Requirements</h2> <p>In this project we want to do the following:</p> <ul> <li>It should have a function to display todos</li> <li>It should have a function to add new todos</li> <li>It should have a function to change a todo</li> <li>It should have a function to delete a todo</li> </ul> <p>Our functions will simplify complex tasks; turning a list of instructions into one simple command.</p> <h2 id="step-1-display-todos">Step 1: Display Todos</h2> <p>In the console:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todos</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&#34;item1&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&#34;item2&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&#34;item3&#34;</span><span class="p">];</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;My Todos:&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p><em>Tip: to create multiple lines in Console use <code>shift</code> + <code>enter</code></em> Then hit enter. Now the function is ready to use.</p> <p>To display todos call the function with:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>The function will now display:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">My</span> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">&#39;item1&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item2&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">&#39;item3&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><h2 id="step-2-add-new-todos">Step 2: Add new Todos</h2> <p>To add new todos to the Array of todos, first create a new function called <code>addTodo</code> and use the <code>push</code> method from version 1:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;new todo&#34;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p><code>addTodo()</code></p> <p>This will add <code>new todo</code> to the array of todos. To see the updated Array use the <code>displayTodos</code> function:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Hit enter and you should see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;item1&#39;, &#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;new todo&#39;] </code></pre><h3 id="functions-within-functions">Functions within functions</h3> <p>Now we can add the <code>displayTodos</code> function to the <code>addTodos</code> function. This way we can immediately see our updated todos Array right after we run <code>addTodos</code>.</p> <p>Press the up arrow a few times to pull up the addTodo function. At the end of the first statement add the <code>displayTodos</code> function:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;new todo&#34;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><h3 id="parameter-in-functions">Parameter in Functions</h3> <p>So we don’t keep adding <code>new todo</code> to the Array each time we use our <code>addTodo</code> function, create a new variable (parameter) to customise the todo.</p> <p>We can call it <code>todo</code>:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Now when we run the function we need to parse an argument.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">addTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;hello there&#34;</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Hit enter and you should see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;item1&#39;, &#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;new todo&#39;, &#39;hello there&#39;] </code></pre><p>In this part we’ve learnt how to customise functions with parameters and how to use those parameters. And how to use functions within functions.</p> <h2 id="step-3-change-a-todo">Step 3: Change a Todo</h2> <p>Create a function to change our todo:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c1">//statement goes here </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>If we used the method from [Version 1], our function might look something like:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">&#34;some new value&#34;</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>But we will need more flexibility in order to target a specific todo item, as currently <code>0</code> will only target the first todo item.</p> <p>We can use parameters again to customise the behaviour of our function.</p> <p>The 2 parts we need to customise are:</p> <ul> <li>the item</li> <li>the value</li> </ul> <p>Luckily functions can take multiple parameters:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Now hit enter to save the <code>changeTodo</code> function.</p> <p>To change the first todo item we can use our function and parse the <code>position</code> parameter, in this case <code>0</code> and then the <code>newValue</code> parameter. In this case we’ll call it ‘changed‘.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="err">‘</span><span class="nx">changed</span><span class="err">’</span><span class="p">)</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You should now see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;changed&#39;, &#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;new todo&#39;, &#39;hello there&#39;] </code></pre><p>As before, we can automatically display the updated todo item Array by adding the <code>displayTodos</code> function after the first statement.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Run the function to display the changed Todo. this time call the first item <code>changed again</code>:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="err">‘</span><span class="nx">changed</span> <span class="nx">again</span><span class="err">’</span><span class="p">)</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You should now see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;changed again&#39;, &#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;new todo&#39;, &#39;hello there&#39;] </code></pre><p>To recap, we wrote a change todo function which takes 2 parameters, <code>position</code> and <code>newValue</code>. We used the <code>displayTodos</code> functions to see the changes.</p> <h2 id="step-4-delete-a-todo">Step 4: Delete a todo</h2> <p>As before, create a new function to delete todos:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c1">// statement goes here </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Using the <code>splice</code> method/command from [Version 1] we can set the ‘position’ and the ‘number of items’ we want to delete.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">splice</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Again, to make this flexible we can use custom parameters like we did last time:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">splice</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Remember to add the <code>displayTodos</code> function so we can see what’s happened.</p> <p>Now run the function and delete the first item from the item Array:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nx">deleteTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>You should now see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;new todo&#39;, &#39;hello there&#39;] </code></pre><p>Now let’s delete <code>new todo</code>, the 3rd item in the todos Array.</p> <p>Remember computers start counting from 0, so this will be item 2 in our Array.</p> <p>Run <code>deleteTodo(2)</code></p> <p>You should now see:</p> <pre tabindex="0"><code>My todos: [&#39;item2&#39;, &#39;item3&#39;, &#39;hello there&#39;] </code></pre><h2 id="v20-review">v2.0 Review</h2> <ul> <li><del>It should have a function to display todos</del></li> <li><del>It should have a function to add new todos</del></li> <li><del>It should have a function to change a todo</del></li> <li><del>It should have a function to delete a todo</del></li> </ul> <p>What we’ve learnt so far:</p> <p>First we created our Todos Array so we have some data to work with:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">todos</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&#34;item 1&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&#34;item 2&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&#34;item 3&#34;</span><span class="p">];</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Then we created a function to <em>display todos</em>:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// It should have a function to display todos </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">console</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">log</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&#34;My Todos:&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This logged out the list of todos.</p> <p>Then we created a function to <em>add todos</em> which took a parameter, so we could provide a value for the new todo:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// It should have a function to add todos </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">addTodos</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">push</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">todo</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This way we can write <code>addTodo('new todo')</code> to create a new todo called ‘new todo’. Adding the <code>displayTodos</code>function allows us to see our changes.</p> <p>From here we crated a <em>change todo</em> function, to allow us to make changes to existing todos in the Array. this function took 2 parameters, for position and value:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// It should have a function to change todos </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">changeTodo</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">postion</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">newValue</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>We displayed todos again so we can immediately see the changes.</p> <p>Finally we create a simple function to delete todos which too 1 parameter:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// It should have a function to delete todos </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kd">function</span> <span class="nx">deleteTodos</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">todos</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">splice</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">position</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">displayTodos</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">}</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Todo app v2.0 done!</p> <h2 id="next-steps">Next Steps</h2> <p><a href="practical-javascript-objects">Part 3</a> looks Objects, what they are and at how we can use them to improve our todo list app. We’ll turn the functions we’ve made so far into methods on an Object.</p> <p>Head over to <a href="https://watchandcode.com/p/practical-javascript" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Watchandcode.com</a> to take the course. I highly recommend Gordon’s teaching style to anyone who has struggled to grasp common JS principles in the past. Gordon uses some of the best examples I’ve seen to explain JavaScript.</p>

item.title: Static search with Algolia and Hugo 2
item.content:encoded: <p class="intro"> This is Part 2 in a short series on getting started with Algolia search on a site built with Hugo, the static site generator. </p> <!-- raw HTML omitted --> <p>In <a href="https://harrycresswell.com/articles/hugo-algolia/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Part 1</a> we configured Algolia’s search API to index content from a Hugo site and provide instantaneous search results, whenever a search takes place.</p> <p>In this part we’ll implement <a href="https://community.algolia.com/instantsearch.js/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Algolia Instantsearch.js</a>, a framework of prepackaged widgets which will help us design the perfect search experience.</p> <p>By the end of the article visitors to our site will be able to interface with the search, searching and filtering content at near instantaneous speeds.</p> <h2 id="what-weve-done-so-far">What we’ve done so far</h2> <p>So far we configured Hugo to generate a JSON index of our content and update the index in Algolia every time we add a new post to our site. We then used a Serverless Webtask function to update the content on our site.</p> <p>A lot to chew, but if you’re still with me then now’s the time to add the actual interface to our website, so visitors can search our posts.</p> <p>So how do we make this good stuff happen?</p> <h2 id="next-steps">Next steps</h2> <ul> <li>Install Algolia InstantSearch JavaScript library</li> <li>Display content from our JSON index (Hits in Algolia talk)</li> <li>Add a search bar to allow for searches</li> <li>Set up post filtering by tag</li> </ul> <p>With that, let’s get right to it.</p> <h2 id="step-1-installing-instantsearchjs">Step 1: Installing InstantSearch.js</h2> <p>In the head of your Hugo site add the Algolia stylesheet and default theme:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">link</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">rel</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;stylesheet&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;text/css&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/instantsearch.js@2.8.1/dist/instantsearch.min.css&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">/&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">link</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">rel</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;stylesheet&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;text/css&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="na">href</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/instantsearch.js@2.8.1/dist/instantsearch-theme-algolia.min.css&#34;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">/&gt;</span>` </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This will deliver the necessary styles from the <a href="https://www.jsdelivr.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">jsDeliver</a> CDN.</p> <p>Next, add the following JS before the closing body tag:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">script</span> <span class="na">src</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/instantsearch.js@2.8.1&#34;</span><span class="p">&gt;&lt;/</span><span class="nt">script</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Great, now we have access to the <code>instantsearch</code> function</p> <h2 id="initialization">Initialization</h2> <p>To initialize InstantSearch.js, you need an Algolia account with a configured and non-empty index.</p> <p>Get hold of your <code>appID</code>, Search-Only <code>APIkey</code> and <code>indexName</code>. You can find these in your Algolia dashboard.</p> <p>In <code>app.js</code> or wherever you store your pre compiled Javascript add the following:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// Set Algolia options </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kr">const</span> <span class="nx">options</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">appId</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;YOUR_APP_ID&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">apiKey</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;YOUR_API_KEY&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">indexName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;YOUR_INDEX_NAME&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">hitsPerPage</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">routing</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kc">true</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">};</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// Parse options to instantsearch </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kr">const</span> <span class="nx">search</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">instantsearch</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">options</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Making sure you replace all instances of <code>YOUR_...</code> as you go.</p> <p>Awesome! Your Hugo site is now connected to Algolia.</p> <h2 id="step-2-display-index-hits-search-results">Step 2: Display index hits (Search results)</h2> <p>Now we need to display our search results and bring this beast to life. Using the hit widget we can display all the results returned by Algolia.</p> <p>Creating a container with an id <code>hits</code> will tell Algolia where to display your hits.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;hits&#34;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c">&lt;!-- Hits widget will appear here --&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>In my site I put this in my <code>list.html</code> template inside <code>layouts/_default/</code> but yours might be different, depending on your theme structure.</p> <p>Now you’ll need to add your hits widget to your instantsearch instance, using <code>addWidget</code>. So open up your JS file and add:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// initialize hits widget </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="nx">search</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">addWidget</span><span class="p">(</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">instantsearch</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">widgets</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">hits</span><span class="p">({</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c1">// define container </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span> <span class="nx">container</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;#hits&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c1">// add classes for styling </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span> <span class="nx">cssClasses</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">root</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;Search-hits&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">empty</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;Search-hits--empty&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">templates</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c1">// call custom hit template </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span> <span class="nx">item</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="nx">hitTemplate</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">empty</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s1">&#39;Didn’t find any results for the search &lt;em&gt;&#34;{{query}}&#34;&lt;/em&gt;&#39;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">})</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Notice I’ve specified the variable <code>hitTemplate</code> for my template item. Setting up this will allow me to parse a <a href="https://community.algolia.com/instantsearch.js/v1/documentation/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Mustache</a> template string and some HTML to customise the view of the hit. Let’s create that variable now.</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// create variable for custom hit template </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kd">var</span> <span class="nx">hitTemplate</span> <span class="o">=</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;a href=&#34;{{ permalink }}&#34; class=&#34;List-item&#34;&gt;&#39;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;div class=&#34;List-image&#34;&gt;&#39;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;img src=&#34;https://res.cloudinary.com/harrycresswell/image/upload/w_auto,dpr_auto,c_scale/{{{featuredimage}}}&#34; /&gt;&#39;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;&lt;/div&gt;&#34;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;div class=&#34;List-title&#34;&gt;{{{_highlightResult.title.value}}}&lt;/div&gt;&#39;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s2">&#34;&lt;/a&gt;&#34;</span> <span class="o">+</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="s1">&#39;&lt;div class=&#34;List-summary&#34;&gt;{{{summary}}}&lt;/div&gt;&#39;</span><span class="p">;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>A few things to notice here; values pulled from the Algolia index should be wrapped in 3 curly braces, this prevents conflicts with Hugo templating, as seen in <code>permalink</code> which is wrapped in 2 braces.</p> <p>Using the <code>_highlightResult</code> attribute will, by default, add <code>&lt;em&gt;</code> tags to your search results to give feedback on any matching results.</p> <p>My particular template pulls in a featured image, which I specified in the post front matter. You’ll notice I’m using <a href="https://cloudinary.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Cloudinary</a> to host my images. By abstracting images away from the repo, build times remain super fast, as now there are no images to process. I’ve added options in the URL for retina and responsive sizing. I cover a lot of these features in <a href="articles/cloudinary/">resposives images with Cloudinary</a>.</p> <h2 id="step-3-configure-hits-in-algolia">Step 3: Configure hits in Algolia</h2> <p>For this part you need to head back to your Algolia Dashboard to set searchable Attributes:</p> <p><em>Indices &gt; Ranking &gt; Searchable Attributes &gt; Add a Searchable Attribute</em></p> <p>This will tell Algolia what you want it to pick up in search results. In my case I kept it simple and stuck with <code>title</code> by choosing it from the dropdown list.</p> <p>Great, title searches should now be configured.</p> <h2 id="step-4-add-a-search-bar-and-algolia-logo">Step 4: Add a Search bar (..and Algolia logo)</h2> <p>In order to querying our index we’re going to need a search bar. To do this add the Searchbox widget to your template:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;search-box&#34;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c">&lt;!-- SearchBox widget will appear here --&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Back in your <code>app.js</code> file, add the following:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// Parse options to instantsearch </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="kr">const</span> <span class="nx">search</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nx">instantsearch</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nx">options</span><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// initialize SearchBox </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="nx">search</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">addWidget</span><span class="p">(</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">instantsearch</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">widgets</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">searchBox</span><span class="p">({</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">container</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;#search-box&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">placeholder</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;Search for post&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">reset</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="kc">false</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">cssClasses</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="p">{</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">root</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;Search-box-container&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">input</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;Search-box-input&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">},</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">})</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">);</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// make all this stuff happen </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="nx">search</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">start</span><span class="p">();</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Now we can search our index and see what matches our query.</p> <h2 id="step-5-add-a-refinement-list-filtering-by-tag">Step 5: Add a refinement list (filtering by Tag)</h2> <p>Finally, you might want to provide filters based on the structure of your content. We can do this by adding the refinement list widget and configuring it to work with our tags in Hugo. Let’s start by setting up Hugo so we can assign tags to our posts.</p> <h3 id="setting-up-tags-in-hugo">Setting up tags in Hugo</h3> <p>If you have been following from <a href="https://harrycresswell.com/articles/hugo-algolia/">Part 1</a>, inside your <code>config.toml</code> file you should have the following:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">[</span><span class="l">params.algolia]</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">vars = [&#34;title&#34;, &#34;summary&#34;, &#34;date&#34;, &#34;publishdate&#34;, &#34;expirydate&#34;, &#34;permalink&#34;]</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span><span class="l">params = [&#34;categories&#34;, &#34;tags&#34;]</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span></code></pre></div><p>It’s important we have <code>tags</code> set in the Algolia Params.</p> <p>Then within your post front matter, add the following to a few of your posts to make sure everything is set up correctly when you re-index your site:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-yaml" data-lang="yaml"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="nt">tags</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span>- <span class="l">your_first_tag</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="w"> </span>- <span class="l">your_second_tag</span><span class="w"> </span></span></span></code></pre></div><h2 id="re-indexing-search-and-configuring-algolia">Re-indexing search and configuring Algolia</h2> <p>Now, from the terminal run <code>npm run build</code> to rebuild your site, then deploy your site how you normally would.</p> <p>This will trigger your search index to be updated.</p> <p>Next head to <em>Indices &gt; Browse &gt; Preview</em> in your Algolia Dashboard and providing all went well you should see your new tags listed in your JSON search index.</p> <p>At this point we need to tell Algolia to filter our tags when we set up our refinement list widget in the next step. To do this head to:</p> <p><em>Indices &gt; Display &gt; Faceting &gt; Attributes for faceting</em></p> <p>Hit <em>Add an Attribute</em>.</p> <p>You should see <code>tags</code> appear in the dropdown list. Make sure you select them and you’re good to go.</p> <h3 id="adding-the-refinement-list-widget">Adding the refinement list widget</h3> <p>The final thing to do is add a refinement list widget so we can filter our results on the font end.</p> <p>Similar to before, add a container with an <code>id=&quot;refinement-list&quot;</code> to your chosen template:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-html" data-lang="html"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;</span><span class="nt">div</span> <span class="na">id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s">&#34;refinement-list&#34;</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="c">&lt;!-- RefinementList widget will appear here --&gt;</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">&lt;/</span><span class="nt">div</span><span class="p">&gt;</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>This is where your refinement list will appear.</p> <p>Just above <code>search.start();</code> in your <code>app.js</code> file, add the following:</p> <div class="highlight"><pre tabindex="0" class="chroma"><code class="language-javascript" data-lang="javascript"><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1">// initialize RefinementList </span></span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="c1"></span><span class="nx">search</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">addWidget</span><span class="p">(</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">instantsearch</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">widgets</span><span class="p">.</span><span class="nx">refinementList</span><span class="p">({</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">container</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;#refinement-list&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="nx">attributeName</span><span class="o">:</span> <span class="s2">&#34;tags&#34;</span><span class="p">,</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"> <span class="p">})</span> </span></span><span class="line"><span class="cl"><span class="p">);</span> </span></span></code></pre></div><p>Your tags should now appear on your site and filter your index.</p> <h2 id="taking-it-further">Taking it further</h2> <p>This is as far as I’m going with this one but you could now add pagination to your index and a filter reset which clears your search. Check out the <a href="https://community.algolia.com/instantsearch.js/v2/getting-started.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">getting started</a> article for more on this.</p> <h2 id="wrapping-up">Wrapping up</h2> <p>Great job.
